Description: Fragment of flattened handle from a Thasian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pale red-brown; a little mica. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Greek inscription and hare symbol.
Curator's comments: Name Herakleides (Thasian fabricant). Garlan, Y., Les timbres amphoriques de Thasos. 1, Timbres protothasiens et thasiens anciens (Paris 1999) 959. Ch. Tchokev, The Athenian Agora xxxvii, 124, no. 111. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 116, 15.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0012)
